content.text:
Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.

What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits".
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered.
- Don't include generic development practices.
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```
I'll analyze this codebase and create a comprehensive CLAUDE.md file. Let me start by exploring the structure and understanding the project.

content.text:
# PartsTown Project Overview

## Project Purpose
PartsTown is an ASP.NET MVC web application targeting .NET Framework 4.8. It appears to be an e-commerce or parts management system with features including:
- Product catalog management with search capabilities (using Lucene.NET)
- Shopping and checkout functionality (integrated with Klarna)
- Tax calculation (Avalara AvaTax integration)
- Image handling and optimization (ImageResizer, Magic360)
- Data export capabilities (EPPlus for Excel)
- Background job processing (Hangfire)

## Tech Stack
- **Framework**: ASP.NET MVC (.NET Framework 4.8)
- **Database**: Entity Framework 6.5.1 with SQL Server
- **Dependency Injection**: LightInject 6.6.4
- **Search**: Lucene.NET 4.8.0-beta
- **Background Jobs**: Hangfire 1.8.18
- **Mapping**: AutoMapper 10.1.1
- **Data Access**: Dapper 2.1.35 (in addition to EF)
- **Cloud Services**: Azure Key Vault for secrets management
- **External Integrations**:
  - Google APIs (Drive integration)
  - Avalara AvaTax (tax calculation)
  - Klarna (checkout/payments)

## Solution Structure
```
PartsTown/
├── PartsTown.sln                  # Solution file with multiple configurations
├── PartsTown/                     # Main web application project
│   ├── Controllers/               # MVC Controllers
│   ├── Views/                     # Razor views
│   ├── App_Start/                 # Application startup configuration
│   ├── CustomData/                # Custom data models/services
│   └── Properties/                # Assembly properties
├── PartsTown.Tests/               # Unit test project
│   ├── BasicTests.cs              # Test classes
│   ├── Helpers/                   # Test helpers
│   └── IoC/                       # IoC container configuration for tests
└── UpdateLogs/                    # Update/deployment logs

```

## Build Configurations
The solution supports multiple build configurations:
- Development (Debug mode, no optimization)
- Staging
- Production
- Release (with MVC view compilation)

## Version Information
Current project version appears to be 4.18.0.3531 (based on package references)
Current branch: 4.18 (based on git status)

content.text:
# Development Commands

## Build Commands

### Using dotnet CLI (if .NET SDK is available)
```bash
# Restore NuGet packages
dotnet restore PartsTown.sln

# Build the solution
dotnet build PartsTown.sln

# Build specific configuration
dotnet build PartsTown.sln --configuration Development
dotnet build PartsTown.sln --configuration Staging
dotnet build PartsTown.sln --configuration Production
dotnet build PartsTown.sln --configuration Release
```

### Using MSBuild (traditional approach for .NET Framework)
```bash
# Restore packages
nuget restore PartsTown.sln

# Build solution
msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Development
msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Release

# Clean and rebuild
msbuild PartsTown.sln /t:Clean
msbuild PartsTown.sln /t:Rebuild
```

## Testing Commands
```bash
# Run tests using dotnet CLI (if compatible)
dotnet test PartsTown.Tests/PartsTown.Tests.csproj

# Run tests using MSTest
mstest /testcontainer:PartsTown.Tests/bin/Debug/PartsTown.Tests.dll

# Run tests using VSTest.Console
vstest.console.exe PartsTown.Tests/bin/Debug/PartsTown.Tests.dll
```

## Package Management
```bash
# Restore NuGet packages
nuget restore PartsTown.sln

# Update a specific package
nuget update PartsTown.sln -Id PackageName

# Install a new package to project
nuget install PackageName -ProjectName PartsTown
```

## Cleaning
```bash
# Windows batch script for complete clean
CleanSolution.bat

# Manual clean
msbuild PartsTown.sln /t:Clean
```

## IIS Express (for local development)
```bash
# Run with IIS Express (from Visual Studio Command Prompt)
iisexpress /path:PartsTown /port:8080

# Or use the configuration from applicationhost.config
iisexpress /site:PartsTown
```

## Git Commands (Current branch: 4.18)
```bash
# Check status
git status

# Create feature branch from 4.18
git checkout -b feature/new-feature 4.18

# Commit changes
git add .
git commit -m "Description of changes"

# Push to remote
git push origin feature/new-feature
```

## Database Migrations (DbUp is included)
```bash
# Run database migrations (typically part of application startup)
# DbUp is configured to run automatically or can be triggered manually
```

## Common Development Workflow
1. `git pull origin 4.18` - Get latest changes
2. `nuget restore PartsTown.sln` - Restore packages
3. `msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Development` - Build
4. Run/debug in Visual Studio or IIS Express
5. `dotnet test` or run tests in Visual Studio
6. Commit and push changes

content.text:
# Code Style and Conventions

## Naming Conventions
- **Classes**: PascalCase (e.g., `Magic360Controller`, `BasicTests`)
- **Interfaces**: Prefix with 'I' (e.g., `ISiteServiceFactory`, `IErrorLogger`, `ISiteUserContext`)
- **Methods**: PascalCase (e.g., `ImageView`, `BasicUserTest`)
- **Private Fields**: PascalCase for readonly fields (e.g., `Magic360CollectionFactory`)
- **Parameters**: camelCase (e.g., `siteUserContext`, `errorLogger`)

## Code Organization
- Controllers inherit from base controllers (e.g., `BasePageController`)
- Heavy use of Dependency Injection through constructor injection
- Service factory pattern widely used (e.g., `ISiteServiceFactory<T>`)
- Clear separation of concerns with dedicated folders for Controllers, Views, etc.

## Testing Conventions
- Test classes use `[TestClass]` attribute (MSTest framework)
- Test methods use `[TestMethod]` attribute
- Test method names are descriptive (e.g., `BasicUserTest`, `ValidateProjectContentFiles`)

## Dependency Management
- NuGet packages managed through packages.config
- Package versions are explicitly specified in .csproj and packages.config
- Project references use HintPath to packages folder

## Configuration Management
- Multiple Web.config transformations for different environments:
  - Web.Development.config
  - Web.Staging.config
  - Web.Production.config
  - Web.Release.config
- Environment-specific settings handled through config transforms

## Compiler Settings
- **Development**: 
  - Debug symbols enabled
  - No optimization
  - Warnings treated as errors (`TreatWarningsAsErrors=true`)
- **Production/Release**:
  - Optimizations enabled
  - PDB-only debug information
  - MVC views pre-compilation in Release mode

## Best Practices Observed
- Constructor dependency injection for all services
- Interface-based programming for loose coupling
- Separation of test project from main project
- Use of factory patterns for service creation
- Clear project organization with logical folder structure

- Environment-specific settings handled through config transforms

## Compiler Settings
- **Development**: 
  - Debug symbols enabled
  - No optimization
  - Warnings treated as errors (`TreatWarningsAsErrors=true`)
- **Production/Release**:
  - Optimizations enabled
  - PDB-only debug information
  - MVC views pre-compilation in Release mode

## Best Practices Observed
- Constructor dependency injection for all services
- Interface-based programming for loose coupling
- Separation of test project from main project
- Use of factory patterns for service creation
- Clear project organization with logical folder structure

input.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

PartsTown is an ASP.NET MVC web application targeting .NET Framework 4.8, serving as an e-commerce platform for parts management with integrated search, tax calculation, and payment processing capabilities.

## Essential Commands

### Build
```bash
# Restore NuGet packages
nuget restore PartsTown.sln

# Build for development
msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Development

# Build for production
msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Production

# Clean and rebuild
CleanSolution.bat  # Complete clean including packages and temp files
msbuild PartsTown.sln /t:Rebuild
```

### Test
```bash
# Run all tests
dotnet test PartsTown.Tests/PartsTown.Tests.csproj

# Using MSTest
mstest /testcontainer:PartsTown.Tests/bin/Debug/PartsTown.Tests.dll

# Using VSTest.Console
vstest.console.exe PartsTown.Tests/bin/Debug/PartsTown.Tests.dll
```

### Local Development
```bash
# Run with IIS Express
iisexpress /path:PartsTown /port:8080
```

## Architecture

### Application Initialization Flow
1. **Global.asax.cs** → `MvcApplication` class handles application lifecycle
2. **PartsTownApplication** (App_Start/) → Core application startup orchestrator
3. **Bindings.cs** → LightInject IoC container configuration
4. **CustomContentProvider** → Custom content management system

### Key Architectural Patterns

**Dependency Injection**: All services use constructor injection via LightInject
- Service factories: `ISiteServiceFactory<T>` pattern for service creation
- Controllers inherit from `BasePageController` with injected dependencies

**Configuration Management**: Environment-specific settings via Web.config transformations
- Development → Staging → Production → Release configurations
- Each environment has its own Web.{Environment}.config transformation file

**Data Access Layer**: Dual approach with Entity Framework 6.5.1 and Dapper 2.1.35
- EF for complex domain operations
- Dapper for performance-critical queries

**Search Infrastructure**: Lucene.NET 4.8.0-beta for product search capabilities

**Background Processing**: Hangfire 1.8.18 for job scheduling and processing

## Build Configurations

- **Development**: Debug symbols, no optimization, warnings as errors
- **Staging**: Intermediate testing environment
- **Production**: Optimized build for production deployment
- **Release**: Production + MVC view compilation for performance

## External Integrations

- **Avalara AvaTax**: Tax calculation services
- **Klarna**: Checkout and payment processing
- **Azure Key Vault**: Secrets management
- **Google Drive API**: File storage integration
- **ImageResizer/Magic360**: Product image handling

## Testing Strategy

Tests use MSTest framework with attributes:
- `[TestClass]` for test classes
- `[TestMethod]` for test methods
- Test project includes IoC configuration for dependency injection in tests

## Project Structure

```
PartsTown/
├── App_Start/           # Application startup and configuration
├── Controllers/         # MVC Controllers (inherit from BasePageController)
├── CustomData/          # Custom data models and services
├── Views/              # Razor view templates
└── Properties/         # Assembly information

PartsTown.Tests/
├── BasicTests.cs       # Main test suite
├── Helpers/            # Test utilities
└── IoC/               # Test dependency injection setup
```

## Development Notes

- Current version: 4.18.0.3531
- Main branch: 4.18 (use for creating feature branches)
- All new services should follow the existing DI patterns
- Maintain separation between Controllers, Services, and Data layers
- Use existing logging infrastructure (`IErrorLogger`) for error handling

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

PartsTown is an ASP.NET MVC web application targeting .NET Framework 4.8, serving as an e-commerce platform for parts management with integrated search, tax calculation, and payment processing capabilities.

## Essential Commands

### Build
```bash
# Restore NuGet packages
nuget restore PartsTown.sln

# Build for development
msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Development

# Build for production
msbuild PartsTown.sln /p:Configuration=Production

# Clean and rebuild
CleanSolution.bat  # Complete clean including packages and temp files
msbuild PartsTown.sln /t:Rebuild
```

### Test
```bash
# Run all tests
dotnet test PartsTown.Tests/PartsTown.Tests.csproj

# Using MSTest
mstest /testcontainer:PartsTown.Tests/bin/Debug/PartsTown.Tests.dll

# Using VSTest.Console
vstest.console.exe PartsTown.Tests/bin/Debug/PartsTown.Tests.dll
```

### Local Development
```bash
# Run with IIS Express
iisexpress /path:PartsTown /port:8080
```

## Architecture

### Application Initialization Flow
1. **Global.asax.cs** → `MvcApplication` class handles application lifecycle
2. **PartsTownApplication** (App_Start/) → Core application startup orchestrator
3. **Bindings.cs** → LightInject IoC container configuration
4. **CustomContentProvider** → Custom content management system

### Key Architectural Patterns

**Dependency Injection**: All services use constructor injection via LightInject
- Service factories: `ISiteServiceFactory<T>` pattern for service creation
- Controllers inherit from `BasePageController` with injected dependencies

**Configuration Management**: Environment-specific settings via Web.config transformations
- Development → Staging → Production → Release configurations
- Each environment has its own Web.{Environment}.config transformation file

**Data Access Layer**: Dual approach with Entity Framework 6.5.1 and Dapper 2.1.35
- EF for complex domain operations
- Dapper for performance-critical queries

**Search Infrastructure**: Lucene.NET 4.8.0-beta for product search capabilities

**Background Processing**: Hangfire 1.8.18 for job scheduling and processing

## Build Configurations

- **Development**: Debug symbols, no optimization, warnings as errors
- **Staging**: Intermediate testing environment
- **Production**: Optimized build for production deployment
- **Release**: Production + MVC view compilation for performance

## External Integrations

- **Avalara AvaTax**: Tax calculation services
- **Klarna**: Checkout and payment processing
- **Azure Key Vault**: Secrets management
- **Google Drive API**: File storage integration
- **ImageResizer/Magic360**: Product image handling

## Testing Strategy

Tests use MSTest framework with attributes:
- `[TestClass]` for test classes
- `[TestMethod]` for test methods
- Test project includes IoC configuration for dependency injection in tests

## Project Structure

```
PartsTown/
├── App_Start/           # Application startup and configuration
├── Controllers/         # MVC Controllers (inherit from BasePageController)
├── CustomData/          # Custom data models and services
├── Views/              # Razor view templates
└── Properties/         # Assembly information

PartsTown.Tests/
├── BasicTests.cs       # Main test suite
├── Helpers/            # Test utilities
└── IoC/               # Test dependency injection setup
```

## Development Notes

- Current version: 4.18.0.3531
- Main branch: 4.18 (use for creating feature branches)
- All new services should follow the existing DI patterns
- Maintain separation between Controllers, Services, and Data layers
- Use existing logging infrastructure (`IErrorLogger`) for error handling

## Available Libraries and Their Purpose

### Core .NET Framework Namespaces
- **System**: Core .NET types and basic functionality
- **System.Collections.Generic**: Generic collections (List, Dictionary, etc.)
- **System.Linq**: LINQ query operations
- **System.Web**: ASP.NET web application functionality
- **System.Web.Mvc**: ASP.NET MVC framework components
- **System.IO**: File and stream operations
- **System.Text**: String and text processing
- **System.Threading.Tasks**: Async/await and task-based operations
- **System.Reflection**: Runtime type inspection
- **System.Runtime**: Runtime services and interop

### Project-Specific Namespaces (PT.*)
- **PT.Core.Model**: Core domain models and business logic
- **PT.Core.Model.IoC**: Dependency injection interfaces and implementations
- **PT.Core.Model.Interface**: Core service interfaces
- **PT.Core.Model.Interface.Sites**: Multi-site support interfaces
- **PT.Core.Model.Interface.Context**: Request/user context interfaces
- **PT.Core.Model.Interface.Service**: Service layer interfaces
- **PT.Core.Model.Interface.SiteRendering**: CSS/JavaScript bundling interfaces
- **PT.Core.Sql**: SQL data access layer
- **PT.Core.Sql.DataProvider**: Data provider implementations
- **PT.Core.Service.Bundling**: Resource bundling services
- **PT.Core.TestTools.Helpers**: Test helper utilities
- **PT.OnlineBusiness**: E-commerce specific functionality
- **PT.One.Controllers**: Base controller implementations
- **PT.TaskTool.VSTools.Projects**: Visual Studio project tools

### Third-Party Libraries (from packages.config)
- **LightInject 6.6.4**: Dependency injection container
- **EntityFramework 6.5.1**: ORM for database operations
- **Dapper 2.1.35**: Micro-ORM for performance-critical queries
- **AutoMapper 10.1.1**: Object-to-object mapping
- **Lucene.Net 4.8.0-beta**: Full-text search engine
- **Hangfire 1.8.18**: Background job processing
- **Avalara.AvaTax 24.10.0**: Tax calculation services
- **Klarna.Checkout 3.0.0.0**: Payment processing
- **Azure.Security.KeyVault.Secrets 4.6.0**: Secret management
- **Google.Apis.Drive.v3**: Google Drive integration
- **ImageResizer 4.2.8**: Image processing
- **EPPlus 4.5.3.3**: Excel file generation
- **HtmlAgilityPack 1.12.1**: HTML parsing
- **Handlebars.Net 2.1.6**: Template engine
- **dbup 5.0.41**: Database migrations
- **Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UnitTesting**: MSTest framework

## Development Notes

- Current version: 4.18.0.3531
- Main branch: 4.18 (use for creating feature branches)
- All new services should follow the existing DI patterns
- Maintain separation between Controllers, Services, and Data layers
- Use existing logging infrastructure (`IErrorLogger`) for error handling
- **STRICT RULE**: Only use the libraries and namespaces listed above - no new dependencies allowed
